The Numbers

Ribble Valley Borough Council's spending data covers £11.4 million across 3,767 transactions with 672 unique suppliers. Data is available from April 2024, making this the most recently published dataset of all eight councils we cover.

With a population of 61,561, Ribble Valley's annual spend works out at approximately £92 per resident — the lowest in Lancashire. This reflects the council's smaller scale of operations and the rural, affluent character of the borough.

Data Limitations

With only two years of data (2024/25 and 2025/26), trend analysis is limited. As more years become available, our analysis will strengthen. Despite this, even in a smaller dataset, patterns emerge — including 35 likely duplicate payment groups totalling £174,500.
